entity1.name: spiders
entity1.description: The process of constructing a web by spiders.;;;A structure made by spiders, consisting of silk threads, used for catching insects and other small creatures.;;;A class of arachnids that produce silk, known for their ability to create intricate webs and the unique properties of their silk.;;;Complex, often sticky structures created by spiders using their silk for various purposes including hunting and shelter.;;;A class of arachnids characterized by their eight legs and ability to produce silk.;;;Complex and intricate structures created by spiders for various purposes such as capturing prey, protection, and reproduction.;;;Complex structures built by spiders using silk for various purposes such as capturing prey, protection, and reproduction.;;;A class of arachnids characterized by their eight legs, ability to produce silk, and predatory nature.;;;A small arachnid that constructs webs using silk.;;;An eight-legged predatory arachnid that constructs and uses webs to catch prey.;;;An arachnid that constructs webs to catch prey.;;;A silk structure created by spiders to capture insects and other small creatures.;;;A class of arachnids known for their ability to produce silk and construct webs.;;;Complex, sticky structures created by spiders using silk for catching prey and other purposes.;;;The process by which spiders create their webs using silk produced from their bodies.;;;A small arachnid that constructs webs to catch prey.;;;A silk structure created by spiders for various purposes, including catching prey and as a habitat.;;;A class of arachnids characterized by their ability to produce silk and having eight legs.;;;A silk structure created by spiders for catching prey and other purposes.;;;A small arachnid that constructs webs and preys on insects.;;;A small arachnid that constructs webs for hunting and protection.

entity5.name: spinnerets
entity5.description: Specialized glands located at the rear of a spider's abdomen used for producing silk.

entity6.name: abdomen
entity6.description: The posterior section of a spider's body, containing vital organs and structures such as spinnerets.

entity8.name: silk
entity8.description: A fine, strong, soft thread produced by spiders and some insects, used for various purposes including web construction and egg sac creation.;;;A fine, strong, soft thread produced by spiders and silkworms.;;;A natural protein fiber produced by spiders and other insects, characterized by its strength and elasticity.;;;Fine threads produced by spiders to construct their webs.
entity8.chunkid: How Spiders Build Webs10;;;How Spiders Build Webs7;;;How Spiders Build Webs15;;;How Spiders Build Webs9;;;How Spiders Build Webs17

entity13.name: branch
entity13.description: A part of a tree that grows out from the trunk or another branch.

entity14.name: wall
entity14.description: A vertical structure that divides or encloses spaces, typically made of brick, stone, or other materials.

entity26.name: prey
entity26.description: An animal that is hunted or caught as food by another animal, in this case, the spider.

entity28.name: trap line
entity28.description: A thick strand of silk used in spider webs as a signal line.
